intro: Fendlera tamaulipana, commonly known as Tamaulipan fendlera, is a shrub native to the Tamaulipan region of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Fendlera tamaulipana is often found in coastal dunes and is an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
